reviews.title: great for family
reviews.text: I stayed at the Marignan in 1973 and was amazed to find it still in existence in 2008. We were a family of two teens and two adults and found the room with bath comfortable, tidy, and convenient.

reviews.title: Quirky and quaint
reviews.text: They offer the use of a kitchen and laundry facility and make one feel quite at home. We spent most of our time out-and-about in Paris, but often had a quiet afternoon siesta in the hotel. As the hotel is only a block or so from the subway it was very convenient to come and go.

reviews.title: Not been there, but...
reviews.text: I recommend this hotel to any budget-minded family who wants more than a hostel but does not mind close quarters.

reviews.title: Hotel Marignan is fantastic!
reviews.text: No frills here but the price and location are great. Staff are friendly. Access to the kitchen saves money but plan to cook (or reheat) before or after the crowd. The library of travel books available is very helpful. Free laundry is fabulous. We stayed in the family room on the ground floor (no stairs!) and had a lovely modern and large bathroom - there was even a hairdryer! On the downside, having a window right on the street was very noisy - not traffic but loud people even into the night. The location can't be beat. The street is quiet but one block in any direction and you are in the middle of shops and restaurants. Funky decor but great for the price.

reviews.title: Great value for flexible travelers
reviews.text: Actually, I didn't stayed there, 'cause i left everything for the last minute and couldn't find double rooms avaliable. Still, the hotel kindly offered instead a lovely studio at Rue du Cardinal Lemoine for rent, all equipped (cable TV, bathroom, kitchen w/sink, cooktop and refrigerator, etc.). I spent a great time there and I only have compliments to the staff, who was very attentive and patient (thanx, Ivona!).

reviews.title: Hotel Marignan, not all Piaf and Wind
reviews.text: We have stayed at Hotel Marignan twice in the last 4 years. We would not consider staying elsewhere, it is in the perfect location, the staff are friendly and will help in any way possible. The breakfast is great, the rooms comfortable but no airconditioning but if you ask for a fan one will be provided. Every person who stays always comes back and has great reviews, we even met a person who stayed 50years ago and keeps comming back and she also works for the travel industry. We would certainly go back should we ever visit Paris again.

reviews.title: Searched for a way to stretch our dollars, and found a priceless hotel
reviews.text: We learned of the Hotel Marignan from a dear friend who has stayed there many times over the years. His enthusiasm made us confident that we were making a good choice, but of course we wondered what tradeoffs we'd face when choosing an inexpensive hotel in the center of Paris. It turns out that the tradeoffs were good ones.

reviews.title: Far from fancy, but swell anyway
reviews.text: We did have three flights of winding stairs to get to our rooms, and we shared our bathroom and shower with others on the floor. On the other hand, we also heard the laughter of children on the stairs, because families can afford to stay there. We huffed and puffed less at the end of our trip, because we were getting some healthy exercise.

reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel for Hostel Prices!
reviews.text: There were a lot of things we liked. We didn't have a fancy breakfast, but our breakfast was satisfying and delicious. French bread, butter, jam, cheese, coffee and milk: we looked forward to them every morning. We really appreciated having a washer and dryer to use rather than drag our laundry down the street or wash clothes in the sink. The restaurant reviews posted downstairs helped us find several good meals.

reviews.title: noisy, reasonably priced, overfamiliar owner, great location
reviews.text: Our room looked out on the quiet street, with a pretty chestnut tree newly leafed out. Restaurants, cash machines, small groceries, and an open-air market were all just a couple of blocks away. Walk a little further, and we were at the Seine. The location is perfect for exploring any part of Paris. Maybe it was the April weather, but we found gardens and flowers everywhere we walked.
We stayed in Marignan for 6 nights in the last week of November, 2008. We enjoyed ourstay here as it met our expectation and budget fully. It is a one-star hotel.
reviews.title: A pleasant, safe and convenient place. Enjoyed the stay.

likes.liked: — The location, breakfast, use of kitchen, free laundry and it being in the Latin Quarter

reviews.text: We are a family of four, with two daughters in the early teens. I booked a quadraple room via the hotel's website and was given a comfimation email within 2 days. I refreshed my confirmation by emailing to them 3 weeks before arrival. We were to spend 6 nights in Amsterdam prior to our arrival in Paris.
reviews.title: Disrespectful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Metro/bus stations are just within a few minutes' walk from the hotel. We took the RER train from the airport. When we came out from the underground station, wow, it was St. Germain Boulavard. The hotel is behind this road in a safe lane. This was the first time I was in Paris and I was glad that I had picked the right location. Within 0.5 km radius from the hotel, there are bakeries, street stalls, restaurants(french, chinese, vietnamese etc)takeaways, grocery shops (one even sells oriental and south east asian stuff), fresh seafood outlet, supermarket, cheese and wine shops.
reviews.title: Bring earplugs

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were greeted in a very pleasant manner and were given a clear briefing about the facilitties available. This hotel, like many European hotels, is housed in an old building. The staircase that is spiralling up is not very steep and is wide enough for us. Our luggage consists of one big suitcase and 3 hand luggage size roller bags. We had no problem bringing them up.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: Our room (No 23 at level 4), is a quadraple room with toilet and wash basin but without shower. You have to pay a little more if you are to take the one with attached shower. There is a common shower in every floor. I had found out earlier from the website that we only had to share the common shower with two other rooms. As I would rather save my euro for better meals in Paris, I decided to go for the one without attached shower. As it turned out, we didn't have any problem in waiting for the shower; the longest we had waited was only 10 minutes. The common shower looked like it had been renovated recently. The water pressure was good too.
reviews.title: This is a great place!
The place with super-helpful and informed staff who understand tourist needs
reviews.text: In over 40 yrs of travelling I have seldom found such a friendly, well-set up budget hotel. Paris is an overpriced city, but this hotel offers a near-perfect solution. It's cheap(er), it's ideally located (you can walk to many top tourist venues, and the metro and bus is nearby for the more distant venues), and it's amenities are practical. But a special mention for the staff and service. Yes, they zealously guard the hotel's peace and quiet (no rowdy guest behaviour is uncommented on), but they are realistic, informed, possess a working sense of humour (unlike some of the reviewers I've read here). The manager is credible, trustworthy and clear. His offsider, Michelle, is a personality in her own right. I'd characterise her as New York Jewish in her expression and sense of humour, and she and I got on just fine. I realise she can startle some, but hey! what do you want? Subservience? I have no hesitation in recommending this hotel as part of the Parisian experience. It's an entertainment in itself, without forgetting to be professional in all the important areas.

reviews.title: Location and comfort
reviews.text: As others have written, great location. Hotel is safe and sanitary. There is a guy at the front desk that makes an effort, but some of the staff are really cold in a weird way. If you plan to take out supper and eat in the downstairs common dining area, forget about it. For the price, though, we may stay there again.

reviews.title: great location but not very pretty
reviews.text: the actual hotel is pretty ugly inside. the rooms are very small without too much attention to aesthetics, but it's a great place to stay if you're going to be out a lot. it's in an amazing location with fantastic cafés around right in the middle of the quartier latin. very very close to a metro stop. there's no elevator so carrying our bags up the stairs sucked a lot. there's an american who's at the front desk a lot who's pretty miserable. she's not very friendly (not mean, just unhappy i think). they "make breakfast" meaning they give you bread and jam and a little coffee or tea. it's good if you're a student who doesn't mind staying in places that aren't really nice. it's very functional and surprisingly clean. i was fine with it but wasn't particularly impressed either.

reviews.title: No frills but great position
reviews.text: My husband, my 24 year old daughter and myself stayed at this hotel in July for 3 nights. The hotel itself is old and what I would call a bit "kitch" with linoleum on the floors and dated furnishings. The room we had was very small with a small bathroom which only contained a toilet and hand basin. We shared the shower which was off the passage next to our room - it was large and very clean and I never saw/heard anyone else using it.

reviews.title: sixth time around
reviews.text: Our room contained a double bed, 2 single beds and a fold out bed (for some reason) with very little room to move round the room. Our daughter slept on the fold out bed as it was slightly larger than the singles. However, the room was adequate as we only slept there - too busy seeing the sights during the day.
